review: Omg this is so gross. It's super loose, sour, and just plain nasty. Has a very gritty texture. Even propped up with add-ins, it's still too soupy.Don't recommend. Going back to coconut yogurt.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2021
name: Enzo
title: Tastes like typical yogurt
review: I prefer the unsweetened protein version they offer over this one. This one has a thinner consistency and less protein. I only get this one if the protein one is out of stock.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2021
name: Amazon Customer
title: Finally a tart plant based yogurt!
review: I have been searching for a good tasting plant based yogurt.I find most of them do not really taste like yogurt they don't have that tartness. Someone recommended Forager to me and this is it!Best I have tried.I wish it were a little thicker like Greek style,but the taste is very good.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021
name: Ashley
title: Good Alternative to dairy!
review: We have this yogurt for our toddler to eat and she loves it! I'm not a big fan myself as it is very tart, but I can see how it would work well to add to other snacks or dishes. I would not eat it plain.

title: amazing!
review: This is one of my favorite non-dairy yogurt. The price is fairly reasonable and it acts just like traditional dairy yogurt pretty much - just slightly more watery.

title: great yogurt alternative for vegans!
review: Forager makes excellent and affordable yogurt alternatives. This plain yogurt is great for smoothies, breakfast, and as a base for creamy sauces. Taste & consistency is similar to regular plain yogurt.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2021
name: Alicia Reece
title: I use it as a sour cream replacement, for sauces and breads
review: I tried Coconut Yogurt first, which works great as just a yogurt - but this is far better for using in sauces and as a replacement for sour cream, as well as a replacement for 3 ingredient dairy free naan. You don't even really need to add lemon because its already a bit tart. That said, I wouldn't use it as a yogurt replacement. It's a bit too powerful of a flavor for that. Price-wise it's amazing deal for sauces, sour creams and breads though :)
